definition: to compete/to take part (in a sports event)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: Participant(s) who fail to produce valid identity documents will not be permitted to participate in the race.
sentences.chinese: 未能出示有效身份證明文件的參賽者，不得出賽。

sentences.english: His performances, once acclimatized to the Premiership, have earned him rave reviews.
sentences.chinese: 他在超級聯賽的出賽表現爲他贏得了輿論的尊重。

sentences.english: Oh, lemon , mama is run horse.
Well, now I'll pass on the tradition to the athletes that are competing next year.
sentences.chinese: 好，現在我要把傳統傳承給明年出賽的運動員。

sentences.english: Woods was scheduled to start the tournament with a new caddie Byron Bell.
sentences.chinese: 伍茲預計要和新杆弟拜倫貝爾一同出賽。

sentences.english: In any Womens race, all team members should be females except the Steersman .
sentences.chinese: 女子組比賽除舵手外全部由女性出賽。

sentences.english: Thank you for covering my games in the United Sates .
sentences.chinese: 感謝你們對我在美國出賽的報導。

definition: to compete/to take part in a competition
to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
competition schedule/the course of a race
